com.inqwell.any

Class LockManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inqwell.any.LockManager

  • public final class LockManager
extends Object
    Support object locking and deadlock detection. Process may negotiate for exclusive access to an object by using a LockManager to acquire, await and notify the release of objects. In addition, the LockManager allows a process to wait on an arbitrary object until another process notifies it, thus allowing processes to synchronise with each other.

      • lockOrEnterWait

        public Process lockOrEnterWait(Process p,
                               Any a,
                               long timeout)
                        throws AnyException
        Process p tries to lock the given object a. If the lock can be obtained then p is returned. Otherwise the process currently holding the lock is returned. If the timeout is non-zero (i.e. indefinite or finite) and the lock cannot be obtained then a lock-wait entry will be made.

        This method is used by implementations of Process that do not have their own thread, such as LockerProxy in the case of remote locks. This LockManager is not responsible for running any timeout that was specified. Some other thread, possibly in another Inq environment, will perform this task and subsequently call exitWait(p, a) for the same process and object.

        Throws:
        AnyException

      • exitWait

        public void exitWait(Process p,
                     Any a)

      • lock

        public boolean lock(Process p,
                    Any a,
                    long timeout,
                    DomainAgent domainAgent)
             throws AnyException
        An attempt by process p to lock Any a. If the object is not already locked by another process, the lock will be established for process p and that process continues execution. Otherwise the process waits for the existing lock to be released, when it will retry.

        If there are several processes waiting, it is undefined which one will obtain the lock when the current lock is released.

        If the same process locks an object more than once the lock count is incremented.

        When a lock is released the same DomainAgent that was supplied in the lock request will be used to release the lock. Note that if the lock count is incremented, the same lock agent must be used in all lock requests or an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        p - the process attempting the lock
        a - the object to be locked
        timeout - the amount of time the caller is prepared to wait for the lock to become available in milliseconds. Zero indicates return immediately, less than zero means wait indefinitely.
        domainAgent - the agent defining the domain in which the lock will take place. DomainAgent.null__ defines the local domain only.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • unlock

        public int unlock(Process p,
                  Any a)
           throws PermissionException
        Unlock object a without force.
        Throws:
        PermissionException

      • unlock

        public int unlock(Process p,
                  Any a,
                  boolean force)
           throws PermissionException
        Unlock object a. If this is the last unlock operation matching the corresponding number of locks then the physical lock will be released and any processes waiting for the object are notified. Otherwise the lock count is decremented. If force is true then the object is unlocked regardless of the lock count.
        Parameters:
        p - The unlocking process
        a - The object to unlock
        force - If true unlock the object regardless of the lock count.
        Throws:
        PermissionException - if p is not the process holding the lock or does not have supervisor rights

      • unlock

        public int unlock(Process p,
                  Any a,
                  boolean force,
                  boolean notify)
           throws PermissionException
        Throws:
        PermissionException

      • unlockList

        public void unlockList(Process p,
                       Composite c,
                       boolean force)
                throws PermissionException
        Unlock all the objects contained in the composite c. If this is the last unlock operation matching the corresponding number of locks then the physical lock will be released and any processes waiting for the object are notified. Otherwise the lock count is decremented. If force is true then the object is unlocked regardless of the lock count.

        This method only notifies waiting threads when all the objects have been unlocked and so is more efficient than unlocking a large set of objects individually.

        Throws:
        PermissionException

      • locker

        public Process locker(Any a)
        Return the process holding an object lock. Returns the process holding the lock on the given object, or null if the object is not locked.

      • lockCount

        public int lockCount(Process p,
                     Any a)
        Return the lock count of object a held by process p.

      • isDeadlocked

        public boolean isDeadlocked(Process p,
                            Array list)
        Scan current object locks and processes in lock-wait to check for deadlock. This method enforces exclusive access to the internal structures used to track object locks.
        Parameters:
        p - the root process for deadlock detection scan. The given process must already be in lock-wait.
        list - if not null, will contain all the processes involved in the deadlock, starting at p
        Returns:
        true if the given process is deadlocked.

      • scanForDeadlock

        public Array scanForDeadlock()
        Scan the processes in lock-wait and return the first list found, if any

      • waitFor

        public Any waitFor(Process p,
                   Any a,
                   long timeout)
            throws AnyException
        Process p will wait on object a until timeout milliseconds have passed or another process calls notify() on the same object or an object a1where a.equals(a1) is true.
        Returns:
        true if p was notified, false if a timeout was specified and no notification was received.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • notifyVia

        public boolean notifyVia(Any a,
                         Process p,
                         boolean all)
        Notify one of any process that may be waiting on the given object a.

        Process p will notify one of zero or more other processes waiting on object a. If process p holds a lock on object a then the notification is sent only once the lock is released.

        Returns:
        true if a process was notified, false if there were no processes waiting on the specified object.
